name: The Black Repertory Theatre of Kansas City
address: Not publicly listed, but serves the Kansas City Metro area
description: This not-for-profit organization uses theater productions and educational programming to enhance the contributions of minorities in the community. They focus on education and the inclusion of Black youth in theater, offering programs like playwriting, scholarships, internships, and mentorships
services: Black-owned Acting instruction in Kansas consultation

name: Black Acting Methods Studio
address: Mobile and online training institute. Specific physical address not provided
description: This institute offers training in acting processes, methodologies, and philosophies rooted in Black American culture and tradition. They provide one-on-one coaching, master classes, and studio instructor certification, with a focus on the "Luckett Paradigm" methodology
services: Black-owned Acting instruction in Kansas consultation

name: KC Melting Pot Theatre
address: Not publicly listed, but is Kansas City's premier African American theatrical company
description: This is Kansas City's premier African American theatrical company, known for productions like "A Raisin in the Sun" and "Ain't No Such Thing as Midnight Black." The artistic director, Nicole Hodges Persley, has also authored a book on audition techniques for actors of color
services: Black-owned Acting instruction in Kansas consultation
